# Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. owns, manufactures, and distributes beverages and single serve brewing systems in the United States and internationally. Formed in July 2018 with the merger of Keurig Green Mountain and Dr Pepper Snapple Group, Keurig Dr Pepper produces and distributes more than 125 hot and cold beverages. The company operates through three segments: U.S. Refreshment Beverages, U.S. Coffee, and International.

This created the third largest beverage company in North America. The company offers its products under the Dr Pepper, Canada Dry, Mott's, A&W, Peñafiel, Snapple, 7UP, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters, GHOST, Clamato, Core Hydration, The Original Donut Shop, Sunkist soda, Squirt, C4 Energy, Hawaiian Punch, Electrolit, Bai, Evian, Yoo-Hoo, Vita Coco, Big Red, Crush, McCafé, Tim Hortons, Van Houtte, Celestial Seasonings, Bigelow, Starbucks, Dunkin', Folgers, Peet's, and Swiss Miss brands. The company is headquartered in Burlington, Massachusetts.

## 2. Current Market Data

Keurig Dr Pepper stock is priced at $27.44, giving the company a market capitalization of $37.27 billion. It carries a P/E multiple of 23.89 and pays a dividend yield of 3.3%. During the past year, Keurig Dr Pepper stock moved between $25.03 at its lowest and $36.12 at its peak.

The market capitalization has decreased by -4.78% over the last week. The last dividend per share was $0.23 USD, with a dividend yield (TTM) of 3.32%.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

KDP operates a two-pronged business model: it controls the dominant single-serve coffee ecosystem in North America and manages a vast portfolio of iconic, ready-to-drink (RTD) beverage brands. The company holds over 70% market share in the U.S. single-serve coffee segment.

### Coffee Segment
• Single-serve coffee brewing systems and K-Cup pods
• Keurig open platform single serve brewing system aimed at changing the way consumers prepare coffee at home and away from home in places such as offices, restaurants, cafeterias, convenience stores and hotels
• Specialty coffee brands including Green Mountain Coffee Roasters, The Original Donut Shop

### Beverage Portfolio
• Carbonated soft drinks: Dr Pepper, 7UP, A&W, Snapple, Canada Dry
• Water and hydration: Core Hydration, Evian
• Juices: Mott's, Hawaiian Punch, Clamato
• Energy drinks: GHOST, C4 Energy

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

### K-Rounds Innovation
KDP unveiled its new K-Rounds plastic- and aluminum-free pods and a new brewing system, the Keurig Alta brewer. K-Rounds pods contain roasted coffee beans that are ground, pressed, and wrapped in a proprietary, protective plant-based coating preserving the coffee's flavor and aroma while eliminating the need for plastic or aluminum packaging. A corresponding brewing device called the Keurig Alta brewer is required to brew these specialty K-Rounds.

### 2025 Flavor Lineup
The company is launching several new products across its beverage portfolio, starting with Dr Pepper Blackberry in both regular and zero sugar varieties. Other new releases include 7UP Tropical with mango and peach flavors, Snapple Peach Tea & Lemonade, two new Bai varieties featuring strawberry, and A&W Ice Cream Sundae in regular and zero sugar options. The company is also launching RC Cola Zero Sugar nationally.

## 5. Growth Strategy

### Energy Portfolio Expansion
KDP is enhancing its operating structure and adding dedicated resources to grow in the category: and has set its sights on achieving a double-digit share position in the coming years. In 2025, the company already expects well over $1bn in retail sales from its energy drink brands, which include Ghost, C4, Black Rifle, Venom Energy and Bloom.

### Platform Approach
KDP's portfolio of complementary energy brands can really target distinct consumer cohorts and demand spaces, including C4 in the performance space, in fitness, strong offerings in high stimulation segment with the ultimate line. Our Black Rifle partnership, mainstream, veteran founded, unapologetically American.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

The company markets and sells its products to supermarkets, mass merchandisers, club stores, pure-play e-commerce retailers, office superstores, restaurants, hotel chains, office product and coffee distributors, partner brand owners, and directly to consumers through Keurig.com website.

The company serves various bottlers, distributors, and retailers, including hypermarkets, supermarkets, mass merchandisers, e-commerce retailers, club stores, office superstores, fountains, vending machines, convenience stores, grocery and drug stores.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

### 2024 Full Year Results
Constant currency net sales growth of 4%, led by U.S. Refreshment Beverages and International segments. Adjusted diluted EPS growth of 8%, marking a second consecutive year of sequential acceleration. Strong operating cash flow growth of 67% to $2.2 billion and free cash flow growth of 82% to $1.7 billion, supporting balanced capital allocation.

Net Sales reached $15,351 million, reflecting a 3.6% increase from the prior year, driven by volume/mix growth and favorable net price realization.

### Q4 2024 Performance
Full Year Revenue Growth: Constant currency net sales grew approximately 4%. Full Year EPS Growth: EPS increased by 8%. Q4 Revenue Growth: Constant currency net sales increased more than 6%. Q4 US Refreshment Beverages Sales Growth: Net sales grew 10.3%. Q4 US Coffee Sales Decline: Net sales decreased 2%. Q4 International Sales Growth: Constant currency net sales increased at a high single-digit rate. Free Cash Flow: Full year free cash flow was $1.7 billion.

### Q3 2024 Results
KDP achieved a 3.1% growth in constant currency net sales, with a solid 3.5% increase in volume mix during Q3. The company reported operating income growth in the high single digits and a 6% increase in EPS, supported by productivity and cost discipline.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

### Headwinds
• U.S. coffee segment faced challenges with a 3.6% decline in net revenue and a 7.2% drop in operating income due to persistent category promotions and pricing pressures. The consumer environment remains dynamic, with still beverage categories under pressure, reflecting current consumer softness.
• Supply chain disruptions, including increased costs for raw materials, packaging, and transportation. Management acknowledges the challenges posed by inflationary pressures, supply chain disruptions, and competitive dynamics.
• Coffee, cocoa, and sugar prices remain sensitive to global supply shifts. Any production challenges in major growing regions can raise costs for beverage and confectionery manufacturers.

### Tailwinds
• KDP's 2025 strategy emphasizes diversification, including growth in the energy drink sector.
• Energy remains one of the fastest growing categories within LRB, close to a double-digit mark over the last three years. I think there remains lots of opportunity to continue to offer differentiated brands that hit unique demand spaces and unique targets. We also like the profitability of the energy category, because it really helps to fund high-quality long-term brand building.

## 9. Market Shares

### Overall Beverage Market Position
Keurig Dr Pepper was the third soft drink brand with a $45.57 billion market cap. Pepsi ranks second, followed by Keurig Dr Pepper. The acquisition and other distribution agreements would give the soft drink giant about 6% share of the overall energy drink market.

### Carbonated Soft Drinks
Dr Pepper has now pulled even with Pepsi for the second spot on the carbonated beverage charts. In 2022, Coca-Cola was ranked as the leading carbonated soft drink company in the United States with a volume share of 46.3 percent. Ranked second, PepsiCo garnered a volume share of 24.7 percent that year.

### Single-Serve Coffee
KDP holds over 70% market share in the U.S. single-serve coffee segment.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

In Q2 2025, PepsiCo commanded a 53.31% market share in nonalcoholic beverages, contrasting with Coca-Cola's 27.35% based on total revenues. As of Q2 2025, PepsiCo held a 53.31% market share in nonalcoholic beverages, substantially larger than Coca-Cola's 27.35%.

KDP carves out a distinct niche as a competitor, offering a different kind of refreshment experience. Formed in 2018 through the merger of Keurig Green Mountain and Dr Pepper Snapple Group, KDP presents a unique challenge to Coca-Cola. KDP's strength lies in its diversified portfolio that extends beyond traditional sodas.

Coca-Cola remains the world's most valuable soft drink brand with a market cap of $298.58 billion as of March 18, 2025. PepsiCo is second at $205.32 billion.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

### GHOST Acquisition (2024)
Under the terms of the agreement, KDP will initially purchase a 60% stake in GHOST, which will be followed by the acquisition of the remaining 40% stake in 2028. The transaction is expected to close in late 2024 or early 2025. In the first stage of the transaction, the Company will make an initial cash investment of approximately $990 million in exchange for a 60% ownership stake in GHOST. Net of anticipated cash tax benefits with a net present value of approximately $140 million, the enterprise valuation represents an approximate 3x net revenue multiple on a projected 2024 basis.

### JDE Peet's Acquisition (2025-2026)
KDP's recommended cash offer for JDE Peet's at €31.85 per share and an eventual separation into two U.S.-listed companies, including a global coffee business serving 100+ countries. The offer period is from 16 January 2026 to 27 March 2026 (unless extended). Closing of the Offer is expected early in the second quarter of 2026, subject to the satisfaction or waiver of the closing conditions.

Keurig Dr Pepper secured US$7 billion from Apollo, KKR, and Goldman Sachs to support its €15.7B (US$18.2 billion) purchase of JDE Peet's. The beverage giant plans to separate by 2026 into Global Coffee Co. and Beverage Co., each operating as an independent public company. CEO Tim Cofer will lead Beverage Co. post-split, while KDP seeks a Global Coffee Co. CEO to drive focused growth and shareholder value.

## 12. Recent Developments

### January 2026
• KDP and JDE Peet's announce launch of recommended cash offer by Kodiak BidCo for all shares, with plans for KDP to split into two companies. Following the acquisition, KDP plans to split into two separate, U.S.-listed public companies: a scaled growth challenger in North America's beverage market and a global coffee leader serving more than 100 countries. The transaction is expected to close in the early second quarter of 2026.

### 2024 Key Events
• Since April 2024, the CEO of Keurig Dr Pepper has been Tim Cofer.
• October 2024: GHOST energy drink acquisition announced
• KDP supported community engagement through partnerships and employee volunteerism, including activation of its multi-year community impact partnership with the American and Canadian Red Cross organizations.

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

### Strengths:
• Dominant position in North American single-serve coffee market (70%+ share)
• Strong financial performance with consistent growth trajectory
• Successful strategic acquisitions expanding energy portfolio
• Robust free cash flow generation ($1.7B in 2024)
• Well-diversified brand portfolio across multiple beverage categories
• Transformational JDE Peet's acquisition creating global coffee leadership

### Challenges:
• Coffee segment headwinds with pricing pressures and volume challenges
• High leverage from major acquisitions creating execution risk
• Supply chain and commodity cost inflation pressures
• Competitive dynamics in beverage industry

### Market Position:
KDP holds a unique position as the third-largest beverage company in North America, with particularly strong positioning in coffee and carbonated soft drinks. The pending JDE Peet's acquisition will create the world's largest pure-play coffee company.

### Growth Outlook:
The company is well-positioned for growth through its energy drink expansion, innovation in sustainable packaging (K-Rounds), and the transformational coffee business creation via the JDE Peet's deal.

**Buy Rating: 7.2/10**

The rating reflects strong operational performance, strategic positioning, and growth potential, balanced against execution risks from major transactions and industry headwinds. The company's diversified portfolio, market leadership positions, and strategic vision support a positive outlook despite near-term challenges.

**Estimated Fair Value: $32-35 per share**

This valuation is based on the company's strong cash flow generation, market leadership positions, strategic acquisition benefits, and growth trajectory in high-margin segments, while accounting for integration risks and current market conditions. The current trading price presents an attractive entry point for growth-oriented investors with moderate risk tolerance.
tldr_summary:
Keurig Dr Pepper is a leading North American beverage company that manufactures and distributes over 125 hot and cold beverages, with a dominant 70% market share in single-serve coffee systems. The company operates through three segments: U.S. Refreshment Beverages, U.S. Coffee, and International, with a portfolio of iconic brands like Dr Pepper, Snapple, and Green Mountain Coffee.

Key investment considerations include strategic expansions in high-margin energy drinks, innovative product developments like K-Rounds sustainable coffee pods, and a transformative $18.2 billion acquisition of JDE Peet's that will create the world's largest pure-play coffee company. The company has demonstrated consistent financial performance with 4% constant currency net sales growth, strong free cash flow generation, and a diversified brand strategy targeting multiple consumer segments.

With a 7.2/10 buy rating and estimated fair value of $32-35 per share, KDP offers attractive growth potential for investors seeking a stable, strategically positioned beverage company with multiple market leadership positions.
